title: Europe, Worried by Other Global Crises, Agrees to Trump’s Trade Deal
summary: The framework agreement will likely not do much for economic growth on either side. But it avoids new fissures on other foreign policy issues, particularly the war in Ukraine.

title: Is the EU Trade Deal With Trump Good for Europe?
summary: Both sides hailed the agreement as the biggest ever. But it will come at a cost to the European Union, and many details have yet to be nailed down.

title: Outrage Grows Over Starvation in Gaza, and a Mysterious Pentagon Budget Line
summary: Plus, a very D.I.Y. act of defiance.

title: ‘Revenge Is Not a Policy’: Israelis Voice Dissent Against the War in Gaza
summary: After a long silence, prominent Israelis and activists are increasingly raising alarms about potential war crimes being carried out by the government.

title: News Organizations Urge Israel to Let Reporters and Aid Into Gaza
summary: Saying that journalists in the territory, like many Gazans, are facing starvation, the groups urged Israel to allow more food in.

title: Thailand and Cambodia Agree to Halt Fighting That Has Killed Dozens
summary: U.S.-backed talks to end the border war, in which militaries have killed dozens of people and displaced hundreds of thousands, began on Monday in Malaysia.

title: A Maine Resort Town Feels the Pressure of Trump’s Immigration Crackdown
summary: Wells, like many U.S. tourist spots that rely on foreign labor, is fearful of immigration raids. The local police department’s agreement to collaborate with federal agents only adds to the anxiety.

title: The Timeless Torches Are New York Liberty’s Dance Warriors. We Need Them.
summary: The dance team of the New York Liberty, in its 20th year, makes space for dancers who are 40 and over. Their message? Dance! Live a full life.

title: How Parenting Changed After Etan Patz
summary: Did the shocking disappearance of a 6-year-old in 1979 forever alter how Americans raised children? Or were there other reasons for parents to be anxious?

title: Avian Flu Wiped Out Poultry. Now the Screwworm Is Coming for Beef.
summary: The parasitic fly that attacks warm-blooded animals was eliminated from the United States in the 1960s, but it’s creeping toward the Texas-Mexico border.

title: Dry Taps, Empty Lakes, Shuttered Cities: A Water Crisis Batters Iran
summary: After a five-year drought and decades of mismanagement, Tehran is at risk of running out of water in several weeks, the government warned.

title: Florida’s New Attorney General, a DeSantis Appointee, Is Making Waves
summary: James Uthmeier has followed an aggressive playbook similar to that of Gov. Ron DeSantis, for whom he used to work behind the scenes as chief of staff.

title: Democrats Plan $20 Million Fund to Target Texas Republicans for Redistricting
summary: At President Trump’s urging, Texas is trying to squeeze up to five Democrats out of office to pad Republicans’ slim majority in the House.

title: Nevada Democrats Spot an Opportunity in a Vulnerable G.O.P. Governor
summary: The state attorney general, Aaron Ford, is seen as Democrats’ best bet to oust Gov. Joe Lombardo. Mr. Lombardo doesn’t plan on going down easy.

title: UnitedHealth Grew to Be a Leviathan. Then Came the Backlash.
summary: The conglomerate was viewed as one of the most successful companies in America, but patients are enraged and investors have lost faith in its business model.

title: U.S. Opens Antitrust Investigation Into NewYork-Presbyterian
summary: The Justice Department scrutiny of one of New York’s leading health systems could lead to more spirited competition among hospitals — and slow rising prices.

title: Why ‘Mankeeping’ Is Turning Women Off
summary: As male social circles shrink, female partners say they have to meet more social and emotional needs.

title: Russia Counters Ukrainian Drones by Turning Off Russians’ Mobile Internet
summary: The same data networks that enable phone apps and web surfing help drones navigate, so officials are imposing daily, patchwork shutdowns. The actions can be very disruptive to daily life.

title: The Supreme Court Owes the Country Explanations for Its Big Decisions
summary: When the court fails to make rulings clear, confusion can set in, and the justices’ credibility can suffer.

title: Sovereignty Is Having a Moment
summary: We explain why leaders are talking so much about independence.

title: Last Soldiers of an Imperial Army Have a Warning for Young Generations
summary: As the 80th anniversary of the end of World War II approaches, only a few veterans of Japan’s brutal war remain. “Never die for Emperor or country,” one advised.

title: The Country Where 76% of Cars Sold Are Electric
summary: Subsidies, hydroelectricity and a manufacturing powerhouse neighbor are moving the cars into Nepal faster than almost anywhere else.

title: Suspect in Traverse City Walmart Stabbing Attack Faces Terrorism Charge
summary: The authorities on Sunday said that a motive for the attack, which left 11 people injured, remained unknown. Citizens, including one who was armed, helped to apprehend the suspect, officials said.

title: C.D.C. Ties 85 Cases of THC-Related Symptoms to Wisconsin Restaurant
summary: The restaurant mistakenly used oil infused with THC, a psychoactive ingredient found in many cannabis products, in food preparation last year, the C.D.C. said.
